metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10685 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
In ncurses 6.0, there is a format string vulnerability in the fmt_entry function. A crafted input will lead to a remote arbitrary code execution attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10685` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib32ncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib32tinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64ncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64tinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libtinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libx32ncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libx32ncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libx32tinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-base - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-bin - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-examples - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-term - 6.1-1ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Red Hat considers this issue as a duplicate of CVE-2017-10684. ccdm94> fix availabe in patch 20170701 for ncurses 6.0.

criterions.comment: ncurses package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1-1ubuntu1').
